revision.text:
{{Infobox Goodall Cup Finals |year=1910 |format=best-of-three |team1='''Victoria''' |team1_short=Victoria |team1_1='''4''' |team1_2= |team1_3='''8''' |team1_tot='''3''' |team2=New South Wales |team2_short=New South Wales |team2_1=2 |team2_2= |team2_3=0 |team2_tot=0 |table-note=<small>* – Denotes overtime period(s)</small> |team1_coach= |team2_coach= F. Dixon |dates= July 23 – July 29 |location1=[[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]]: [[Sydney Glaciarium]] |series_winner=Keith Walker }} The '''1910 [[Goodall Cup]] Final''' was the second inter-state ice hockey championship in Australia and for the first time was held in the [[Sydney Glaciarium]].
==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), captain Robert Jackson and D. Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game two
;Game three
{|class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Game-by-game !Winning Team !Score !Losing Team !Scoring Summary !Location |- |1||July 23||Victoria|| align="center"|4-2||New South Wales|| '''NSW''' - Pike, Turnbull '''VIC''' - A. Reid (2), Jackson, Woods ||rowspan="4"|[[Sydney Glaciarium]] |- |2||July||Victoria|| align="center"| ||New South Wales|| |- |3||July 29||Victoria|| align="center"|8-0||New South Wales|| '''VIC''' - H. Reid (5), A. Reid (3) |- !colspan="7" style="text-align:left;"|Victoria win best-of-three series 3 games to 0 |}
== Teams ==
===Victoria=== The Victoria team was made from the following players * Robert Jackson (Captain) * Andrew Reid * Hal Reid * Keith Walker * D. Woods * Charles Watt (Goaltender)
===New South Wales=== The New South Wales team was made from the following players * Norman Ducker (Captain) * Arthur Cuthbertson * Les Turnbull * Jack Pike * W. Forsyth * Cyril Lane (Goaltender)
==See also== {{Portal|Ice hockey|Australia}} * [[Goodall Cup]] * [[Ice Hockey Australia]] * [[Australian Ice Hockey League]]
==References== {{reflist}}
{{Goodall Cup Finals}}

==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), captain Robert Jackson and D. Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>

{{Infobox Goodall Cup Finals |year=1910 |format=best-of-three |team1='''Victoria''' |team1_short=Victoria |team1_1='''4''' |team1_2= |team1_3='''8''' |team1_tot='''3''' |team2=New South Wales |team2_short=New South Wales |team2_1=2 |team2_2= |team2_3=0 |team2_tot=0 |table-note=<small>* – Denotes overtime period(s)</small> |team1_coach= |team2_coach= F. Dixon |dates= July 23 – July 29 |location1=[[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]]: [[Sydney Glaciarium]] |series_winner= }} The '''1910 [[Goodall Cup]] Final''' was the second inter-state ice hockey championship in Australia and for the first time was held in the [[Sydney Glaciarium]].
==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), captain Robert Jackson and D. Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game two
;Game three
The evening of Friday 29 July 1910 marked the third straight win for Victoria with a convincing 8-0 victory over New South Wales. The goals were scored by Hal Reid, who had five goals and his brother Andrew Reid with three goals.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363164?zoomLevel=4|title=Hockey Match on the Ice|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=2 August 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
{|class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Game-by-game !Winning Team !Score !Losing Team !Scoring Summary !Location |- |1||July 23||Victoria|| align="center"|4-2||New South Wales|| '''NSW''' - Pike, Turnbull '''VIC''' - A. Reid (2), Jackson, Woods ||rowspan="4"|[[Sydney Glaciarium]] |- |2||July||Victoria|| align="center"| ||New South Wales|| |- |3||July 29||Victoria|| align="center"|8-0||New South Wales|| '''VIC''' - H. Reid (5), A. Reid (3) |- !colspan="7" style="text-align:left;"|Victoria win best-of-three series 3 games to 0 |}
== Teams ==
===Victoria=== The Victoria team was made from the following players * Robert Jackson (Captain) * Andrew Reid * Hal Reid * Keith Walker * D. Woods * Charles Watt (Goaltender)
===New South Wales=== The New South Wales team was made from the following players * Norman Ducker (Captain) * Arthur Cuthbertson * Les Turnbull * Jack Pike * W. Forsyth * Cyril Lane (Goaltender)

==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), captain Robert Jackson and D. Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game two
;Game three
The evening of Friday 29 July 1910 marked the third straight win for Victoria with a convincing 8-0 victory over New South Wales. The goals were scored by Hal Reid, who had five goals and his brother Andrew Reid with three goals.<ref name="3rdgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363164?zoomLevel=4|title=Hockey Match on the Ice|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=2 August 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>

{{Infobox Goodall Cup Finals |year=1910 |format=best-of-three |team1='''Victoria''' |team1_short=Victoria |team1_1='''4''' |team1_2='''12''' |team1_3='''8''' |team1_tot='''3''' |team2=New South Wales |team2_short=New South Wales |team2_1=2 |team2_2=0 |team2_3=0 |team2_tot=0 |table-note=<small>* – Denotes overtime period(s)</small> |team1_coach= |team2_coach= F. Dixon |dates= July 23 – July 29 |location1=[[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]]: [[Sydney Glaciarium]] |series_winner= }} The '''1910 [[Goodall Cup]] Final''' was the second inter-state ice hockey championship in Australia and for the first time was held in the [[Sydney Glaciarium]].
==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), captain Robert Jackson and D. Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game two Wednesday 27 July 1910 proved to be a difficult day for New South Wales as Victoria overwhelmed them by a score of 12-0.<ref name="2ndgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363088?zoomLevel=3|title=Hockey|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=29 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game three
The evening of Friday 29 July 1910 marked the third straight win for Victoria with a convincing 8-0 victory over New South Wales. The goals were scored by Hal Reid, who had five goals and his brother Andrew Reid with three goals.<ref name="3rdgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363164?zoomLevel=4|title=Hockey Match on the Ice|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=2 August 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>

Reid (2), Jackson, Woods ||rowspan="4"|[[Sydney Glaciarium]] |- |2||July||Victoria|| align="center"|12-0||New South Wales|| |- |3||July 29||Victoria|| align="center"|8-0||New South Wales|| '''VIC''' - H. Reid (5), A. Reid (3) |- !colspan="7" style="text-align:left;"|Victoria win best-of-three series 3 games to 0 |}

===New South Wales=== The New South Wales team was made from the following players * Norman Ducker (Captain) * Arthur Cuthbertson * Les Turnbull * Jack Pike * W. Forsyth * Cyril Lane (Goaltender)

Dixon |dates= July 23 – July 29 |location1=[[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]]: [[Sydney Glaciarium]] |series_winner= }} The '''1910 [[Goodall Cup]] Final''' was the second inter-state ice hockey championship in Australia and for the first time was held in the [[Sydney Glaciarium]].
==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), captain Robert Jackson and D. Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game two Wednesday 27 July 1910 proved to be a difficult day for New South Wales as Victoria overwhelmed them by a score of 12-0.<ref name="2ndgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363088?zoomLevel=3|title=Hockey|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=29 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game three
The evening of Friday 29 July 1910 marked the third straight win for Victoria with a convincing 8-0 victory over New South Wales. The goals were scored by Hal Reid, who had five goals and his brother Andrew Reid with three goals.<ref name="3rdgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363164?zoomLevel=4|title=Hockey Match on the Ice|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=2 August 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>

{{Infobox Goodall Cup Finals |year=1910 |format=best-of-three |team1='''Victoria''' |team1_short=Victoria |team1_1='''4''' |team1_2='''12''' |team1_3='''8''' |team1_tot='''3''' |team2=New South Wales |team2_short=New South Wales |team2_1=2 |team2_2=0 |team2_3=0 |team2_tot=0 |table-note=<small>* – Denotes overtime period(s)</small> |team1_coach= |team2_coach= F. Dixon |dates= July 23 – July 29 |location1=[[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]]: [[Sydney Glaciarium]] |series_winner= }} The '''1910 [[Goodall Cup]] Final''' was the second inter-state ice hockey championship in Australia and for the first time was held in the [[Sydney Glaciarium]].
==The series==
The inter-state ice hockey championship was held between a state representative team from [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] and from [[New South Wales]]. This tournament was a best-of-3 format and saw Victoria win the series 3 games to 0.
;Game one 23 July 1910 was the first game of the series and was held at the [[Sydney Glaciarium]] in front of an enthusiastic crowd. Victora defeated the New South Wales team by a score of 4-2 with goals being scored by Victorians Andrew Reid (who had 2 goals), Robert Jackson and Dudley Woods. Scoring for New South Wales was done by Jack Pike and Les Turnbull.<ref name="1stgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1302543?zoomLevel=1|title=The Glaciarium|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=25 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game two Wednesday 27 July 1910 proved to be a difficult day for New South Wales as Victoria overwhelmed them by a score of 12-0.<ref name="2ndgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363088?zoomLevel=3|title=Hockey|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=29 July 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
;Game three
The evening of Friday 29 July 1910 marked the third straight win for Victoria with a convincing 8-0 victory over New South Wales. The goals were scored by Henry "Hal" Newman Reid Jr. , who had five goals and his brother Andrew Reid with three goals.<ref name="3rdgame">{{cite news|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/363164?zoomLevel=4|title=Hockey Match on the Ice|newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)]] |date=2 August 1910 |accessdate=28 September 2015}}</ref>
{|class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Game-by-game !Winning Team !Score !Losing Team !Scoring Summary !Location |- |1||July 23||Victoria|| align="center"|4-2||New South Wales|| '''NSW''' - Pike, Turnbull '''VIC''' - A. Reid (2), Jackson, Woods ||rowspan="4"|[[Sydney Glaciarium]] |- |2||July||Victoria|| align="center"|12-0||New South Wales|| |- |3||July 29||Victoria|| align="center"|8-0||New South Wales|| '''VIC''' - H. Reid (5), A. Reid (3) |- !colspan="7" style="text-align:left;"|Victoria win best-of-three series 3 games to 0 |}
== Teams ==
===Victoria=== The Victoria team was made from the following players * Keith Walker (Captain) * Robert Jackson * Andrew Reid * Dudley Woods * Henry "Hal" Newman Reid Jr. * Cyril Macgillicuddy (Goaltender)
===New South Wales=== The New South Wales team was made from the following players * Les Turnbull (Captain) * Cyril Lane * Dunbar Poole * Jack Pike * Arthur Cuthbertson * Graham (Goaltender)
==Player Statistics==
===Scoring Leaders=== The following players led the interstate championship for points.
<!-- IMPORTANT: Rank players by Pts, then G, then GP (fewer) If there is more than 10 players, '''nonetheless list all the leaders''' --> {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="width: 12em;" | Player ! style="width: 13em;" | Team ! style="width: 4em;" | {{abbr|GP|Games Played}} ! style="width: 4em;" | {{abbr|G|Goals}} ! style="width: 4em;" | {{abbr|A|Assists}} ! style="width: 4em;" | {{abbr|Pts|Points}} |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Henry Newman|Reid Jr.}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] || 3 || 5 || 0 || 5 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Andrew Lambert|Reid}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] || 3 || 4 || 0 || 4 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Robert Edward|Jackson}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] || 3 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Dudley|Woods}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] || 3 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Jack|Pike}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[New South Wales]] || 3 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Les|Turnbull}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[New South Wales]] || 3 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Keith Curwen|Walker}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] || 3 || 0 || 0 || 0 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Dunbar|Poole}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[New South Wales]] || 3 || 0 || 0 || 0 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Arthur|Cuthbertson}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[New South Wales]] || 3 || 0 || 0 || 0 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Cyril|Lane}} || style="text-align:left;"| [[New South Wales]] || 3 || 0 || 0 || 0 |}
===Leading goaltenders=== The following goaltenders led the interstate championship for [[goals against average]].
<!-- IMPORTANT: Rank players by GAA (lower), then SV%, then W, then GP --> {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! style="width: 10em;" | Player ! style="width: 12em;" | Team ! style="width: 3.5em;" | {{abbr|GP|Games Played}} ! style="width: 3.5em;" | {{abbr|W|Wins}} ! style="width: 3.5em;" | {{abbr|L|Losses}} ! style="width: 4em;" | {{abbr|GA|Goals Against}} ! style="width: 3.5em;" | {{abbr|SO|Shutouts}} ! style="width: 4em;" | {{Abbr|GAA|Goals Against Average}} |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|Cyril|Macgillicuddy}} || style="text-align:left;"| Victoria || 3 || 3 || 0 || 2 || 2 || 0.67 |- style="text-align:center;" | style="text-align:left;"|{{sortname|.|Graham}} || style="text-align:left;"| New South Wales || 3 || 1 || 3 || 24 || 0 || 8.00 |}
